meanings: ((in)) the front line, ((in, at)) the forefront

examples.korean: Tanks have been deployed all along the front line. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 모든 최전선 지역에 죽 탱크가 배치되었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Tanks have been deployed all along the front line. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: a life spent in the front line of research 듣기 Add to Wordbook 연구 활동의 최전선에서 보낸 일생 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: a life spent in the front line of research Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: The regiment was sent to fight in the front line. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 연대는 최전선에서 싸우도록 투입되었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The regiment was sent to fight in the front line. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: We could not fire, as we were masked by our first line. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 아군의 최전선이 방해를 받고 있어서 우리가 포격을 할 수 없었다. Friendict Level English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: We could not fire, as we were masked by our first line. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Since its inception in 1968, the company has been at the forefront of computer development. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 1968년 시작한 이후, 그 회사는 컴퓨터 개발의 최전선에 있었다. YBM All in All English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Since its inception in 1968, the company has been at the forefront of computer development. Add to Wordbook
